intro: Microtropis keningauensis, commonly known as the Keningau microtropis, is a flowering plant native to Borneo. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers and woody stems. The plant typically grows in lowland rainforests and is often found in secondary forest areas. It has simple, alternate leaves that are usually ovate or elliptic in shape. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
